seal.  Your obstetrician will 
guide your baby out, as you 
push with your contractions.  
This can take several pulls and 
you may need an episiotomy.
Listen carefully to your 
obstetrician and midwife 
during the delivery so you 
know when to push and when 
to pant. 
Once your baby’s head is 
delivered, your obstetrician 
will remove the forceps or 
ventouse from your baby’s 
head and your baby will be 
delivered onto your abdomen, 
‘skin-to-skin’.  Once the cord 
has been cut, you
